books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and mind control to maintain power.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.summary: A young girl witnesses her father defending an innocent black man in the racially segregated South.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: The obsessive quest of Captain Ahab to kill the giant white whale, Moby Dick, becomes a metaphor for human obsession.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A tale of decadence and disillusionment during the Jazz Age, revolving around Jay Gatsby's unrequited love.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: The romantic entanglements and societal challenges of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy in Regency-era England.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: The story of Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teen who struggles with societal expectations and personal loss.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: A dystopian future where humans are engineered for specific roles, and individuality is suppressed for societal harmony.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A scientist creates a monster, only to be horrified by the consequences of his creation and its destructive power.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: Bilbo Baggins, a reluctant hobbit, embarks on a dangerous adventure to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A historical epic exploring Russian society during the Napoleonic wars, focusing on love, duty, and loss.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.summary: The epic tale of Odysseus' perilous journey home after the Trojan War, encountering mythical creatures and gods.

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.summary: A look at the history of humanity, exploring how Homo sapiens came to dominate the planet.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: Dorian Gray, a young man obsessed with beauty, keeps his portrait aging while his physical self remains youthful.

books.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
books.author: C.S. Lewis
books.summary: A group of children are transported to the magical land of Narnia, where they fight to defeat an evil queen.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.summary: A young shepherd named Santiago journeys across the desert to find a treasure, discovering his personal legend.

books.title: The Catch-22
books.author: Joseph Heller
books.summary: In World War II, Captain Yossarian grapples with absurd bureaucratic rules that prevent him from escaping the war.

books.title: The Road
books.author: Cormac McCarthy
books.summary: A father and son navigate a post-apocalyptic world, trying to survive and hold on to their humanity.

books.title: The Silent Patient
books.author: Alex Michaelides
books.summary: A woman murders her husband and then refuses to speak, leading a psychotherapist to uncover the truth behind her silence.

books.title: Educated
books.author: Tara Westover
books.summary: A memoir of a woman who grows up in a strict, survivalist family and eventually escapes to pursue education.

books.title: The Girl on the Train
books.author: Paula Hawkins
books.summary: A woman is drawn into the investigation of a missing woman after she witnesses something unusual from her train.
